grails.plugin.springsecurity.authentication.encoding

Class PBKDF2PasswordEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • grails.plugin.springsecurity.authentication.encoding.PBKDF2PasswordEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.security.authentication.encoding.PasswordEncoder

    public class PBKDF2PasswordEncoder
extends Object
implements org.springframework.security.authentication.encoding.PasswordEncoder
    PBKDF2 salted password hashing, from https://crackstation.net/hashing-security.htm
    Author:
    havoc AT defuse.ca, Burt Beckwith

      • slowEquals

        protected boolean slowEquals(byte[] a,
                 byte[] b)
        Compares two byte arrays in length-constant time. This comparison method is used so that password hashes cannot be extracted from an on-line system using a timing attack and then attacked off-line.
        Parameters:
        a - the first byte array
        b - the second byte array
        Returns:
        true if both byte arrays are the same, false if not

      • pbkdf2

        protected byte[] pbkdf2(char[] password,
            byte[] salt,
            int iterations,
            int bytes)
        Computes the PBKDF2 hash of a password.
        Parameters:
        password - the password to hash.
        salt - the salt
        iterations - the iteration count (slowness factor)
        bytes - the length of the hash to compute in bytes
        Returns:
        the PBDKF2 hash of the password

      • fromHex

        protected byte[] fromHex(String hex)
        Converts a string of hexadecimal characters into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        hex - the hex string
        Returns:
        the hex string decoded into a byte array

      • toHex

        protected String toHex(byte[] array)
        Converts a byte array into a hexadecimal string.
        Parameters:
        array - the byte array to convert
        Returns:
        a length*2 character string encoding the byte array
